00020 /**
00021  * @file   MsgSocketHandler.h
00022  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00023  * @date   Thu Jan 21 16:26:33 PST 2010
00024  * 
00025  * @brief  File for handling messages from Verbose handler to a socket
00026  */
00027 
00028 #ifndef MSGSOCKETHANDLER_H
00029 #define MSGSOCKETHANDLER_H
00030 
00031 #include <cstring>
00032 #include <string>
00033 #include <vector>
00034 #include "util/MsgHandler.h"
00035 #include "util/ProgressHandler.h"
00036 //
00037 class SocketClient;
00038 
00039 #define SOCKETSTOP "_SOCKET_STOP_"
00040 #define FATALERROR "FATAL ERROR:"
00041 
00042 
00043 /**
00044  * @brief An abstract handler for messages.
00045  */
00046 class MsgSocketHandler : public MsgHandler, public ProgressHandler {
00047 
00048 public:
00049 
00050   /** 
00051    * Constructor
00052    * @param verbosity - Verbosity level to print at higher -> more messages
00053    */
00054   MsgSocketHandler(int verbosity);
00055 
00056   /**
00057    * Destructor
00058    */
00059   ~MsgSocketHandler();
00060 
00061   /** 
00062    * Check to see if handler has been sent the message to abort by server.
00063    */
00064   void checkForKill();
00065 
00066   /** 
00067    * Open a socket for reading/writing on the specified host and port
00068    * 
00069    * @param host - Ip address, often 127.0.0.1 or localhost
00070    * @param port - Which port to open
00071    */
00072   void openSocket(const std::string &host, const std::string &port);
00073 
00074   /** 
00075    * Begin a progress reporting. After this initial call the
00076    * progressStep call will be called N times where N = the parameter
00077    * total passed in below.
00078    * 
00079    * @param verbosity - What level of verbosity is the progress
00080    * associated with. Higher levels of verbosity produce more
00081    * messages.
00082    * @param msg - String message associated with the beginning of this task.
00083    * @param total - Expected number of times that the progressStep()
00084    * will be called after this.
00085    */
00086   virtual void progressBegin(int verbosity, const std::string &msg, int total);
00087 
00088   /** 
00089    * This function is called when one unit of work has been done. In
00090    * general it is expected that the units of work should be roughly
00091    * equal in size.
00092    * 
00093    * @param verbosity - At what verbosity level should this step be
00094    * displayed.
00095    */
00096   void progressStep(int verbosity); 
00097 
00098   /** 
00099    * Signals the end of progress report. 
00100    * 
00101    * @param verbosity - Level of verbosity associated with this progress report.
00102    * @param msg - Closing message from calling function.
00103    */
00104   void progressEnd(int verbosity, const std::string &msg);
00105  
00106   /** 
00107    * A message to be processed by the handler.
00108    * 
00109    * @param level - What level of verbosity is associated with this message, higher number == more verbosity.
00110    * @param msg - Message that is to be processed.
00111    * @param delimiter - Should a delimiter be emitted as well?
00112    */
00113   void message(int level, const std::string &msg, bool delimiter = true);
00114   
00115   /** 
00116    * What level of verbosity is requested. This is a hint to the class and can
00117    * be ignored if desired.
00118    * 
00119    * @param level - Level below which progress messages are printed.
00120    */
00121   void setBaseVerbosity(int level);
00122 
00123   /**
00124    * Send message indication termination of computation.
00125    */
00126   void finishedMsg();
00127 
00128   /**
00129    * Set end of line suffix
00130    */
00131   void setEndOfLine(const std::string &s) {
00132       m_EndLine = s;
00133   }  
00134 protected:
00135   
00136   SocketClient *m_Client; ///< Class for reading from and writing to socket.
00137   int m_LocVerbosity;     ///< Our verbosity level
00138   int m_Total;         ///< How many steps total are we expecting?  
00139   std::vector<std::string> m_Messages; ///< Buffer for messages from the socket.
00140   std::string m_EndLine; ///< Any end to tack on messages (like "\n");
00141 };
00142 
00143 #endif /* MSGHANDLER_H */
